data.title: Pamela C. Kloeppel
data.meta_description: Pamela C. Kloeppel, American Counselor. Certified teacher, principal, supervisor, counselor, Virginia.
data.text:
Pamela C. Kloeppel Edit Profile

counselor

Pamela C. Kloeppel, American Counselor. Certified teacher, principal, supervisor, counselor, Virginia.

Background

Kloeppel, Pamela C. was born on April 9, 1943 in Norfolk, Virginia, United States. Daughter of Bishop Marvin and Nell (Lewis) Cuthrell.

Education

Bachelor, Mary Washington College, 1964. Master of Education, University Virginia, 1968. Doctor of Education, University Virginia, 1970.

Postdoctoral student, Old Dominion University, 1978.

Career

Teacher, Virginia Beach Public Schools, 1964-1967; counselor, Albemarle County (Virginia) Public Schools, 1968-1970; vocational and secondary counselor, Norfolk (Virginia) Public Schools, 1970-1978; director guidance, Norfolk (Virginia) Public Schools, since 1978. Consultant in field various school system.

Achievements

Membership

Member, chairman Virginia Vocational Advisory Council, 1980-1983. Member access council College Board, 1987-1990, vice chairman, 1990-1993, chairman, 1993. Member Norfolk Interagy.

Conference, since 1982, Virginia Governor's Block Grant Commission, Richmond, 1983-1984. Volunteer Norfolk Adolescent Pregnancy and Prevention Service. Member American Association Counseling and Development, Virginia Counselor Association, Hampton Rds.

Counselor Association (career service award), Virginia Association Counselors Educators and Supervisors (past president), Little Neck Garden Club, Club of Virginia Beach, Rotary (board directors 1987-1990).

Interests

Avocations: decorating, antiques, reading.
